intro: Gymnanthes serrata var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy sycamore, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsules that contain seeds with a fleshy, orange aril. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
